member.name: P:Retyped.jquery_backstretch.JQueryBackStretch.BackStretchOptions.centeredX
member.summary: The ratio of the width/height of the image doesn't always jive with the width/height of the window. This parameter controls whether or not we center the image on the X axis to account for the discrepancy.

member.name: P:Retyped.jquery_backstretch.JQueryBackStretch.BackStretchOptions.centeredY
member.summary: This parameter controls whether or not we center the image on the Y axis to account for the aforementioned discrepancy.

member.name: P:Retyped.jquery_backstretch.JQueryBackStretch.BackStretchOptions.duration
member.summary: This is the speed at which the image will fade in. Integers in milliseconds are accepted, as well as standard jQuery speed strings (slow, normal, fast).

member.name: P:Retyped.jquery_backstretch.JQueryBackStretch.BackStretchOptions.fade
member.summary: The amount of time in between slides, when using Backstretch as a slideshow, expressed as the number of milliseconds.

member.name: M:Retyped.jquery_backstretch.JQueryBackStretch.BackStretch.resize
member.summary: This method is called automatically when the container (window or block-level element) is resized, however you can always call this manually if needed.

member.name: M:Retyped.jquery_backstretch.JQueryBackStretch.BackStretch.show(System.Double)
member.summary: Jump to the slide at a given index, where n is the number of the image that you'd like to display. Slide number starts at 0.

member.name: M:Retyped.jquery_backstretch.JQueryBackStretch.BackStretch.next
member.summary: Advance to the next image in a slideshow.

member.name: M:Retyped.jquery_backstretch.JQueryBackStretch.BackStretch.prev
member.summary: Display the previous image in a slideshow.

member.name: M:Retyped.jquery_backstretch.JQueryBackStretch.BackStretch.destroy
member.summary: Destroy the Backstretch instance. Optionally, you can pass in a Boolean parameter, preserveBackground, to determine whether or not you'd like to keep the current image stretched as the background image.

member.name: M:Retyped.jquery_backstretch.JQueryBackStretch.BackStretch.destroy(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Destroy the Backstretch instance. Optionally, you can pass in a Boolean parameter, preserveBackground, to determine whether or not you'd like to keep the current image stretched as the background image.
